concern:
Will be having my Master's Thesis proposal defense in the morning, and I'm all a bit tense and anxious and nervous and all the things that have going through my head. 

Been sleepy all day as if this is a way for me to cope with the stress it causes. Wish me luck everyone, good luck also to the countless graduate students who will be defending their own works!


Update: 

I cant believe it's done! I passed the proposal defence. Now I cant rest for a week from .

dialogue_total.statement: Hi there! I'm glad you're here. Please feel free to share what's on your mind or anything you'd like to discuss today.

Hey, thanks for meeting with me. I just wanted to chat about how I felt leading up to and after my Master's Thesis proposal defense. It was such a whirlwind of emotions, and even though I passed, I still feel a bit of that stress lingering.

It sounds like your Master's Thesis proposal defense was quite an emotional experience for you. You feel a mix of relief for having passed, but also some lingering stress from the whole process. Can you share more about what aspects of the experience stood out to you?

client: Yeah, it was just such an intense buildup, you know? The anticipation and the fear of messing up were overwhelming. Even though it turned out okay, I think my brain is still processing all of that pressure.
It seems like the anticipation and fear really took a toll on you, even though the outcome was positive. What do you think would change for you if that lingering stress eased up?
Honestly, I think I'd feel a lot lighter and more relaxed. I could probably focus better on what's next and enjoy the break I have without that constant tension hanging around.

It sounds like feeling lighter and more relaxed would really allow you to enjoy your break and focus on future tasks without that tension. What are some things that have helped you unwind or relax in the past?

Well, sometimes just taking some time to myself, maybe going for a walk or listening to music, can help me unwind. I also find that hanging out with friends or doing something creative, like drawing, can be pretty soothing.

It sounds like spending time alone, going for walks, listening to music, and engaging in creative activities have been helpful for you in the past. Based on what you shared, possible options for easing this lingering stress could include setting aside regular time for these activities or trying something new like a creative project. What would you like to focus on to help you feel lighter and more relaxed?

I think setting aside some time for my hobbies would be a good start. Maybe I could plan a mini creative project or have a dedicated music hour each day to unwind and help shift my focus away from stress.

That sounds like a wonderful plan. Setting aside time for your hobbies and having a dedicated music hour could really help you unwind and shift your focus. It's great to see you're taking these steps towards feeling lighter and more relaxed. Remember, it's okay to take things one step at a time and be gentle with yourself as you transition away from this stress. If you feel like you need more support or adjustments along the way, I'm here to help. Keep nurturing those creative projects and music sessions, and let yourself enjoy the moments. You're doing an amazing job finding what works best for you.
Thanks, that means a lot. I'll try to remember to be gentle with myself as I get started on these changes.
